intro: Leptinella intermedia, commonly known as the Alpine penny-cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has hairy, branched stems and small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. Leptinella intermedia is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky soils.
